alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 19 at 2:01PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Arizona near Cottonwood, including the following county, Yavapai. * WHEN...Until 700 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 159 PM MST, trained weather spotters reported heavy rain in the advisory area due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Coyote Spring, Cherry Creek, Blowout Creek, Cienega Creek, Sycamore Creek, Oak Wash, Grief Hill Wash, West Clear Creek, Dry Beaver Creek, Verde River, Gaddis Wash, Beaver Creek, Munds Draw, Ash Creek, Bitter Creek, Russell Wash, Oak Creek and Railroad Draw. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Camp Verde, Clarkdale, Verde Village, Cottonwood, Bridgeport, Cherry, Middle Verde, Mcguireville, Montezuma Castle National Monument, Lake Montezuma, Jerome, Dead Horse Ranch State Park, Tuzigoot National Monument, Mingus Mountain Campground, Playground Group Campground and Potato Patch Campground. - This includes the following highways... State Route 260 between mile markers 207 and 224. Interstate 17 between mile markers 280 and 294. State Route 89A between mile markers 335 and 359. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding of washes and creeks will occur, some dirt roads will become muddy and impassable. Paved roads and underpasses could become flooded as well.
